Replies.Reply: I'm sorry... It's alright, I'm not gonna hurt you.
It's ok, calm down, evrything's gonna be fine.
Just give me a minute to figure things out.
Just give me a minute I said.
How many people are in this thing? Listen! We can't go climbing around in here.
Ubitraps. I looked into a room down there and something almost cut my  head off!
What the hell are you doing?
Wait a second! Let's all just relax for a minute. Does anybody remember  how they got here?
Please, we're spooked anough as it is. Let's rule out aliens from now on  and concentrate on what we know.
There's a way in here, so there's gotta be a way out. We can avoid the  traps using the boot. Holloway is it. What do you think? For an exit?
Leaven, we can do this. We just have to stay calm, and work together as a team. There's gotta be a lot of people looking for us on the outside. I'm a cop, alright?
Yeah... I'm gonna get you out of here, I promise, but you gotta be with me on this one...
Why the hell didn't the boot set it off.
How come, you know so much about sensors, Renz?
Fine, you're french. I'm asking how...
Rennes... Sensorexpert... With the right age... I don't believe it...
The Wren. The bird of Attica. through the coop on six major prisons.
So it was electrochemical or whatever, right? And he missed it.
Alright... It's time to reassess this place.
Forget about all that! You can't see the big picture from in here. So don't try. Keep your head down. Keep it simple.
Start with us. We got an escapeartist and a cop.
Why don't you tell us what your purpose is Worth!
Kids.. Three of them... I haven't made my piece yet.
Leaven, your glasses? You don't need them?
Well, they took off her jewelry, but they must have put these on you. If nothing is random... why are they here.
Leaven, what do you read in school? Math?
Wait, wait, wait. How can you make that decision based on one primenumbertrap?
Leaven, you beautiful brain... Boot it.
5 'o clock stubble. the last thing I remember was shaving.
Now don't worry. I'll be home in time for dinner.
Holloway... Just real yourself in a bit. Come on. Were moving along, things are looking up.
Talk to me. Have a conversation. What kind of doctor are you anyway?
Ok. We have three boys. Nine, seven and five.
She didn't either................. She's not dead, we're just separated.
You could try and help me out here buddy.
What are you talking about Holloway?
Holloway, what's the military industrial complex? Have you ever been  there? I'm tellin' you, it's not that complex.

What do you think these establishments is? It's just guys like me. Their  desks are bigger, but their jobs aren't. They don't conspide, they... buy boats. No,  this place is... Remember Scaramanga? The bad guy in "The Man With The Golden Gun".  It's some rich psyco's entertainment.
Your boy's having a conniption sitting there.
Is that your two bits worth, Worth?
I had a feeling about that fucking guy. He knew about that trap.
Then your numbersystem failed, but he knew.
You're the paranoid, think about it. His only function so far is to kick us when we're down.
Trust me on this, it's my job to read people like an x-ray.
Well that's handy, like if there was nothing fucking else we could do.
And you find this all pretty funny, don't you?
What's your fucking problem Worth? Even Holloway's holding up better than  you. Get over there and help her with him. That's your job, babysitter!
Somebody has to taka responsibility around here.
Not all of us have a luxury of playing nihilists.
It's the will to live, everybody's got it Worth, even you, especially you  hiding behind that cynical front.
Arh, poor Worth: "Nobody loves me". If that's the chip on your shoulders,  then why did you lug it all this way? Why didn't you just lie down and die!
Do it. Show us you have some backbone and jump into the sushimachine. Be  a man.
Do you think they would lay clues, if there wasn't a way out.
Put us out of your misery so we can get on and get out of here.
Bullshit! You knew from square one. Look at him, he's up to his eyeballs  in this thing.
What kind of fucking explanation is that?
Somebody had to say yes to this thing.
We have no idea, what it is.
Maybe we can get the door open.
I'm dealing with that Holloway. I'm looking for practical solutions here.
We cut the risk with the numbers and the boot. Worth will go in first.
Is there room for two in there?
I guess that means we're not having dinner.
Must be reat to ignore it.
Who knows how many detours we'll have to take. I say we cross the bitch.
How many boots do we have left Holloway?
Get it off him. We know how it works, we just have to be quiet.
I'm glad you're on sight Worth, because you're up.
He's unpredictable. When we get to the edge we can come back for him, but  he will get somebody killed here. Am I right?
Law of the jungle Holloway. He's a danger in the pack!

You listen to me woman. Every day I mop up after your bleeding heart. The  only reason why you exist is because I keep you! I know your type. No kids, no man to  fuck you. So you go around outraged sticking your nose up in other peoples assholes,  sniffing their business! You missed your boat Holloway. You are all dry up inside  there aren't you? That's your fucking problem.
Can't see shit. Nothing to hang on to.
We have to try something. We gotta see if the door's over there. Someone  has to swing over there and take a look. We make a rope of our clothes. Take it off.  I'll tie it onto myself.
That's as far as you go.
Leaven, you gotta be strong sweetheart.

We gotta get down to the bottom. It'll be easier to get on to shell from  there. It's a long fucking way with only one boot. But we gotta do it, before we get  too weak. You gotta keep cracking the numbers Leaven.
Sure you can. It's your gift.
An hour is as long as I say.
We have to make it down to the bottom. There'll be quiet there and you  can concentrate.

They're traps! We are the key. I get us down there. You think us out.  Believe in me. Try to see what I see, how my mind works. THRASH! When I look into  someone's head like a fucking x-ray. I looked through the walls. I dreamed him at his  desk, designing everything. He can't let you solve the puzzle. There is a purpose. We  are the purpose. The cube is us.
We fit like numbers. A man and a woman. Two halves of the equation. I  take you down. The perfect key.
I'll slip you on the lock.
Leaven... It's time to go down.
Get away from her. Leaven, they're fucking spy's. Him, the retard.  Holloway had outside information about my family. She went too far.
You wanna come with us Worth? Down the hatch.
You were right Worth. There is no outta here.
What difference does it make? We're dead anyways.
The numbers tell you all that?
Ok, so it's moving. How do we get out?
I just wanna know, don't you wanna know?
Fuck the traps, let's get to the bridge.
But you can, right? You can?
I'm not dying in a fucking ratmaze.
You're telling me Tell-A-Son boy is a genius.
There's only one way to find out.
What's the numbers boy? Right here! Look here! Make him do it.
Move. Come on let's go. You too Worth. Move your scuddy ass Worth, I'm  not through with you yet. Leaven open up that door, and get Einstein working on the  numbers.
Not even close, Worth! When I'm finish I'll throw you in a fucking trap  on the way out of here.
Where is he? Come here! I said come here riiight..........
Let me take a look at that. It's ok, I'm a doctor, it doesn't look bad.
Perogies! I was eating dinner. Perogies, cheese and potato. I ran out of  sour cream and then I went to the fridge and then I... I don't know...
Middle of the night. It's like Chile. They always come in the middle of the night.
Only the government can build something this ugly.
Room numbers, they're different in each room.
There'd better not be! We have about three days without food and water before we're too weak to move.
Oh, we have heat, stress, physical exhaustion i.e. dehydration, headaches, dizziness, disorientation, confusement. Mental process.
I've been over it again and again, why would they throw innocent people in here? Are we being punished?
No, it just makes me go: "Why me, and not one of the ten million other doctors out there"!
I think we have to ask the big questions: What does it want? What is it  thinking?
Nice, nice. I ain't got anyone either, but I'm not giving up. I'm pissed off. The came into our homes. They stripped us bare. They took my rings. They took my... my amethyst.
You'd remembered all that in your head?
I need to smoke! I could smoke a butt of a sidewalk.
Ok. You're right, I quitted smoking years ago. I just need to be occupied.
Uh, you know, the free kinda... Er, come on help me. Tell me about your rugrats.
Oh, good God. Poor woman. There's no way I'd survived that.
I'm sorry, I can't just shoot the breeze.
What are you? His coatrack? Oh please.
Hey there, are you all alone? Do you wanna hold my hand, honey?
There's lots of blue rooms. We'll find another one to you real soon.
Will you just worry about your own numbers...
Go on, I'll look after him.
Shall we go for a walk? Kazan, do you wanna go for a walk?
Erm' Quentin. Let's not make him do the climbing thing right away.
Could they have taken us all the way to New Mexico?
I'm talking about: "Where do you hide something this big?" It has at  least got to fill something.
I'm sorry to shake your foundations Quentin, but you have no idea where your tax-dollars go.
Only the military industrial complex can afford to build something this size.
And how would you know from where you are.
Ok, you're a cop. Single bullet theory. Right on.
It's ok. I just swallowed my button.
Knew what? How could he know?
So, he has a bad attitude. So you think that makes him spy.
Erm, not here honey, over in the corner.
For Gods sake, Worth. You knew what it was.
No Quentin. That's how they stay hidden. You keep everyone separated so  the left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing. The brain never comes out in  the open.

It's all the same machine right. Pentagon. Multinational coorporations.  The police! If you do one little job. You build a widget in Saskatoon. The next thing  you know, it's two miles under the desert, the essential component of a deathmachine.  I was right! All along my whole life I knew it. I told you Quentin. Nobody's ever  call me paranoid again. We gotta get out of here and blow the lid of this thing.
Then tell me, please, I need to know.
What have we come to? It's so much worse than I thought.
Is that how we're ruining the world?
That's why you stayed with us. To confess.
Have you gone absolutely mad? He's the only one who knows nything about  the place.
What we need to do is figure out how we get around the traps.
Well, you haven't found any yet!
No he won't Quentin, we take turns!
So that's it. The edge is surrounded by traps.
Shame on you. Will you look at yourselves. What have you turned into?  They may have taken our lives away, but we're still human beings. That's all we've  got left.
That's a lie and you know it.
Quentin! You let that innocent boy go.
No wonder your wife left you. All that bottled-up anger. And a thing for  young girls.
God help you Quentin. Did you smack your kids around too?
She's right Quentin, you're too heavy. I'm the lightest after Leaven.  Anyways it's my turn.
How long did you know people we're put in here.
That's not long , if you consider your whole life.
There's nothing down here. Hold tight. I'll try swinging over there.  Place yourself I'm gonna try again. Ok, one more time.
What the hell is going on?
Oh God, oh God, oh God.
Shouldn't we wait here? To see if anybody comes.
They have to feed us, don't they?
I've never done anything to deserve this!
Nothing, I jst go to school, hang out with my friends.
There is nothing else. My parents are these people I live with them... I'm boring.
Primenumbers. I can't believe I didn't see it before.
I have a facility for it.
If we get out, I'l make you dinner.
This is just way too bizarre.
Safe, obviously. Since he almost fell on my head.
I hate this! I hate this!
I don't know what happened. it wasn't prime.
I guess the numbers are more complicated than I thought.
No, it means they're more involved, the works for us up to now have just  been bad, I just need more time with them.
They're not Tarot-cards. Do you have any idea on how many variables I  have to consider before I can decide from numbers this size!?!? They don't reveal  themselves right away!
Excellent! Now it totally reeks in here!
A cube! Why didn't you tell us?
Daah! Have you been on glue all of your life. I felt guilty for ruining  the world since I was like... seven. God! If you need someone to blame, throw a rock.
And it's a cube, like this?
What are the dimensions of the outer shell?
Cartesian co-ordinates, of course, coded Cartesian co-ordinates. They are  uses in geometry to plot points on a three-dimensional graph.
Bonjour, these numbers are markers, a grid-referance, like altitude and  longitude on a map. The numbers tell us where we are inside the cube.
It works! Ok, all I have to do now is add the numbers together. The X  co-ordinate is 19, Y is 26 rooms. So that places us... seven rooms from the edge.
How come the sound of the door-opening didn't set it off?
Well, I guess we have to backtrack and try somewhere else.
How dare you say that to her? You don't know her Quentin. None ouf us  know eachother here.
Is anybody besides me interested in what's on the other side of that  door?
Yeah, you're gonna go. You weigh like 500 pounds it'll snap in two  seconds. I'm the lightest.
It's not a gift, it's just a brain.
Do you just wanna leave them?
Give us the boot, you pig!
You figure it out! You haven't done anything. All you do is freak out!  YOU MURDERER!
It's the only logical explanation. I'm such an idiot.
Give me a minute. The numbers are markers point on a map, right?
And how do you map a point that keeps moving?
Permutations. A list of all the co-ordinates the room passes through.  Like a map that that tells you where the room starts, how many times it moves and  where it moves to.
I don't know. I've only been looking at one point on the map, which is  probably the startingposition. All I saw, was how the cube looked like before it  started to move.
You remember that room we passed through before, the one with the  co-ordinate larger than 26?
That co-ordinate placed the room outside the cube.
Right, but only in it's original position.
Look, the room starts off as a bridge, then it moves it's way through the  maze, which is where we ran into it, but at some point it must return to it's  original position.
... in a short period of time. This thing is like a giant  combinationlock, when the rooms are in their startingposition ht elock is open. But  when they move out of the linement the lock closes.

Don't! We find it's original co-ordinates by adding the numbers, the  permutations is found by subtracting the numbers. It's it. The room moves to 0, 1 and  -1 on the x-axis, 2, 5 and -7 on y, and 1, -1 and 0 on z.
You suck in math? Ok, I need the roomnumbers around as a referencepoint.
Technically I can identify the traps.
First I thought they were identified by primenumbers, but they're not.  They're identified by a number that are the power of a prime.
I have to calculate to numbers of factors in each set. Maybe if I had a  computer...
By those numbers the room should be safe.
Kazan, we gonna do some numbers, ok? We like to do numbers, right?
That's right. Can you tell me the factors of 656?
You don't have a lot of lives left.
Come here Worth, this room's next move takes it to the bridge.
Over here. Move it. We don't have much time come on.
Give me a minute. Be patient. So guess what, this was the room we started  in. I was right, we should never have moved in the first place.
What are you doing. You can't quit now. It's not your fault!!!
Why are you afraid of that room?
I've wondered that myself. I'm just a guy, I work in an officebuilding, doing officebulding stuff. I wasn't actually bursting joie de vivre before I got here. Life just sucks in general.
They don't look prime to me.
Of course it's what is worth.
Maybe they mean nothing at all.
And that somebody has to be you.
Not all of us are conceded enough to play hero.
The will to live. That's the warm, coasy feeling deep inside. Thanks  partner, I'm a new man.
Fuck you Quentin. I don't wanna die, I'm just being realistic. Do you  think they just builded this thing so we could just walk out of it?
There is no way outta here!!!
I am the poison. I designed the outer shell.
Not this part, the exterior. I don't know anything about the numbers or  anything else in here. I was contracted to draw plans for a hollow shell. A cube.
I didn't ask. I never even left my office. I talked on the phone to some  other guys like me. Specialists working on small details. Nobody knew what it was.  Nobody cared.

It's maybe hard for you to understand, but there's no conspiracy. Nobody  is in charge. It's a headless blunder operating under the illusion of a masterplan.  Can you grasp that? Big brother is not watching you.
come to is that there is nobody up there.
What thing? Only we know what it is.

We know more than anybody else. I mean somebody might have known  sometime, before they got fired or voted out or sold it. But if this place ever had a  purpose, then it got miscommunicated or lost in the shuffle. This is an accident, a  forgotten propetual, public, worksproject. Do you think anybody wants to ask  questions? All they want is a clear conscience and a fat paycheck. I mean, I lead on  my desk for months. This was a great job!
Because it's here. you have to use it or admit it's pointless.

walk a beat. It's like you said Quentin is: Keep your head down, keep it simple, just  look at what's in fron of you! I mean nobody wants to see the big picture. Life's too  complicated. I mean, let's face it. The reason we're here is it's out of control.
Still looking for someone to bust, Quentin?
Wherever the doorguy put it. Six guesses and it's sealed from the  outside.
The inner cube cannot be flushed by the shell. There is a space.
I don't know. It makes sense.
Just out of curuiosity. I mean don't hit me again or anything. But what  are you gonna do when you get there?
Door number six, not door number one, door number two.
Sssh! Come on Kazan. Kazan will you please stop doing that!
Let her sleep for a while. We haven't slept for fucking hours.
How the fuck are you gonna know how long an hour is?
It's The Wren, the old Renster.
Wasn't Rennes killed in that room?
How come there's nothing out there.
We were not at the edge before. Where's the room that killed Rennes?
HEY! Listen to what I'm saying! There was a room there before! We haven't  been moving in circles, the rooms have!
That explains the thunder, the shaking. We've been shifting the whole  time.
What are you on to Leaven.
So the bridge is just a bridge...
Well the size of us... It must take days to complete a full cycle.
Can you work out the traps in the system?
Well you threw out our last boot, you fucking idiot.
Kazan, I'll give you a whole box of gumdrops for each answer.
You want 'em in bags, you got 'em in bags.
I guess that proves out theory. The numbers.
I'm gonna find him. What do you think?
Yeah, good. Erm, you have to climb up here, ok?
I have nothing to live for out there.
Kazan get out to the door!
Motiondetectors integrated in the walls. Tough to spot.
We don't solve the act, sitting still. I'm moving at this straight line,  till I get to the end.
It ain't gonna be that simple. Take a look around. Take a good long look around, see it. Coz, I got a feeling it's looking at us.
It's mechanical. Seems to come at regular intervals.
Suck on it... Keeps the saliva flowing.
The air seems dry in there.
The boot's not alive. It detects hydrogen-sulfide extruded from the skin.

Yes, I'm Harry "fucking" Houdini. The only reason I dragged you so far, is cause I need your boots. If you're not smarting up I'm gone like that. No more talking... No more guessing. Don't even think about something which is not right in front of ya.
I wanna go back to the blue room.
Butter first, then honey, Kazan. Butter first then honey.
I wanna go back to the blue room.
I don't like the red ones.
